description: Creates a batch inference job to invoke a model on multiple prompts. Format your data according to Format your inference data and upload it to an Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, see Process multiple prompts with batch inference. The response returns a jobArn that you can use to stop or get details about the job.

parameters.name: jobName
parameters.description: A name to give the batch inference job.

parameters.name: roleArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the service role with permissions to carry out and manage batch inference. You can use the console to create a default service role or follow the steps at Create a service role for batch inference.

parameters.name: clientRequestToken
parameters.description: A unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure that the API request completes no more than one time. If this token matches a previous request, Amazon Bedrock ignores the request, but does not return an error. For more information, see Ensuring idempotency. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: modelId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the foundation model to use for the batch inference job.

parameters.name: inputDataConfig
parameters.description: Details about the location of the input to the batch inference job. s3InputDataConfig (dict) --- Contains the configuration of the S3 location of the input data. s3InputFormat (string) --- The format of the input data. The S3 location of the input data. s3BucketOwner (string) --- The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the S3 bucket containing the input data.

nested_params.name: s3InputDataConfig
nested_params.description: Contains the configuration of the S3 location of the input data.

nested_params.name: s3InputFormat
nested_params.description: The format of the input data.

nested_params.name: s3Uri
nested_params.description: The S3 location of the input data.

nested_params.name: s3BucketOwner
nested_params.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the S3 bucket containing the input data.

parameters.name: outputDataConfig
parameters.description: Details about the location of the output of the batch inference job. s3OutputDataConfig (dict) --- Contains the configuration of the S3 location of the output data. The S3 location of the output data. s3EncryptionKeyId (string) --- The unique identifier of the key that encrypts the S3 location of the output data. s3BucketOwner (string) --- The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the S3 bucket containing the output data.

nested_params.name: s3OutputDataConfig
nested_params.description: Contains the configuration of the S3 location of the output data.

nested_params.name: s3Uri
nested_params.description: The S3 location of the output data.

nested_params.name: s3EncryptionKeyId
nested_params.description: The unique identifier of the key that encrypts the S3 location of the output data.

nested_params.name: s3BucketOwner
nested_params.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the S3 bucket containing the output data.

parameters.name: vpcConfig
parameters.description: The configuration of the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) for the data in the batch inference job. For more information, see Protect batch inference jobs using a VPC. An array of IDs for each subnet in the VPC to use. (string) --- An array of IDs for each security group in the VPC to use. (string) ---

nested_params.name: subnetIds
nested_params.description: An array of IDs for each subnet in the VPC to use.

nested_params.name: securityGroupIds
nested_params.description: An array of IDs for each security group in the VPC to use.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Any tags to associate with the batch inference job. For more information, see Tagging Amazon Bedrock resources. (dict) --- Definition of the key/value pair for a tag. Key for the tag. Value for the tag.

nested_items.name: jobArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the batch inference job.
